Sentencas: The redox behavior of terbium and praseodymium doped yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) is studied.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: The aim is to identify spectroscopic probes and a suitable experimental procedure to monitor the oxygen activity in YSZ electrolytes in solid oxide cells with spatial resolution and at operation conditions (e.g. at high temperatures).
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: Sintered ceramics and crystals with 0.3 to 10 at% content of Pr or Tb ions in YSZ were prepared.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: Upon equilibration in atmospheres from 10-20 to 100 bar PO2 around 800 degrees C, the majority of these rare earth ions are in the 3 + oxidation state.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: At oxygen pressures above 0.001 bar, the small proportion of Tb4+ and Pr4+ formed give rise to intense optical absorption around 300-500 nm and to decreased reflectance.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: From the reflectance measurements it is shown that the Tb4+ concentration increases as PO2 1/4, as correspond to the trapping of the holes generated upon the oxygen incorporation as Tb4+.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: This competitive absorption causes a decrease of the Tb3+ luminescence.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: A quantitative relationship of the Tb3+ luminescence intensity with PO2 at 800 degrees C has been found, which is compatible with the trapping model.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte

Sentencas: The spatial resolution of the experimental procedure could be very roughly estimated of the order of 100 mu m.
Titulo: Probing High Oxygen Activity in YSZ Electrolyte
